data.title: Airports in Serbia: List of 9 Domestic & International Airports
data.meta_description: List of Airports in Serbia: Learn more about all the Domestic & International Airports in Serbia, Address, ICAO/IATA Codes, Category, Terminals and other important details.
data.text:
As you acquire all the details about the operating airports for passenger and cargo traffic, you realise the ease of conveyance you can enjoy while travelling.

Note: The services and other factors keep changing frequently. So, please verify all information before planning your trip.

1. Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport (BEG), Beograd

This Serbian International Airport is named after Nikola Tesla, a Serbian-American inventor. This airport opened in March 1927 and rests in the suburbs of Surcin, about 18 km west of downtown Belgrade. It is the busiest and largest of all the airports in Serbia.

Address: Aerodrom Beograd 59, Beograd 11180, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYBE

IATA Code: BEG

Category: International

Terminals:

Terminal 1 (T1) – It is the oldest and the smallest terminal on the east side of this airport. It is used for international flights. The airlines operating here are both international low-cost and domestic airlines.

Terminal 2 (T2) – It is the newer terminal on the airport's west side. The first level of Terminal 1 is for departures and arrivals, which is the boarding level. The second level is the arrivals and baggage claim level, where you can find all the arriving flights.

Services & Amenities Available

Duty-free stores

Baby care rooms

Post office

Rest zones

Mobile charging space

Medical service

Luggage wrapping

Pharmacy

Premium lounge

Business club with services such as showers, snacks, etc.

2. Ponikve Airport (UZC), Ponikve Plateau

Founded in 2016, Ponikve airport rests in the Ponikve plateau in the region of western Siberia. Ponikve Airport is located 12 km from the city of Uzice. In the context of runway length, the Ponikve airport ranks second, having the biggest runway in Siberia.

Address: 52 Dimitrija Tucovica St. 31000 City of Uzice, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYUE

IATA Code: UZC

Category: International

Terminals: This airport has only one terminal for handling passengers, goods and mail.

Services & Amenities Available: NA

3. Sjenica Airport (SJC), Bagačiće

The Sjenica Airport was in use by the Yugoslav army air force. The airport got damaged during the NATO bombing of 1999. This airport is also known by another name Dubinje Airport. It is located on the Pester plateau near the town of Sjenica. It is also close to a tourist destination in the mountain resort named Zlatar.

Address: Sjenica Airport, Bagačiće, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYSJ

IATA Code: SJC

Category: Military

Terminals: NA

Services & Amenities Available: NA

4. Sombor Military Airport (SOR), Sombor

The Sombor Military Airport stands between the villages of Prigrevica and Kupusina. The Germans built the airport in 1944. Located 7 km from the city of Sombor and 9 km from the town of Apatin, the nearest city and towns of this airport are Sombor and Apatin. The airport serves the region of Sombor and sits at an elevation of 272 feet.

Address: 107, Sombor, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYSO

IATA Code: SOR

Category: Military

Terminals: NA

Services & Amenities Available: NA

5. Morava Airport (KVO), Tavnik

Morava Airport is also known by another name Ladjevci Airport. Founded in 2016, this airport is 15 km from Kraljevo, 25 km from Čačak, and 39 km from Kragujevac. After the completion of its construction, it had 235th Fighter-Bomber Squadron. Morava Airport was first built in 1967 as a military airport. However, it has been upgraded to a civilian airport, making it the third commercial airport in Serbia.

Address: Morava Airport, Aerodrome 51, Tavnik, 36204 Ladjava, Kraljevo

ICAO Code: LYKV

IATA Code: KVO

Category: Public and Military

Terminals: The Morava airport has only one passenger terminal.

Services & Amenities Available

Lost baggage

Assistance for individuals with less mobility

Special assistance for expecting mothers

6. Niš Constantine the Great Airport (INI), Ulica

Niš Constantine is located in the border crossing area of the suburbs of Popovac and Medosevac. The first flight that flew out of this airport dates back to 1 May 1935. As of today, it is the largest airport in Serbia that carries out cargo services.

Address: Ulica 24, Niš 18000, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYNI

IATA Code: INI

Category: Public and Military

Terminals: The Niš Constantine has only one terminal for passenger traffic.

Services & Amenities Available

The services available at the Niš Constantine the Great Airport are as follows:

Lost and found baggage

Special assistance for people with less mobility

Assistance for expecting mothers

7. Kostolac Airport (KOS), Kostolac

The Kostolac Airport was built in 1988. The airport is quite close to Pozarevac and Kostolac town centre. One interesting thing to note here is that landing on the Danube water plane is similar to landing on an aircraft carrier.

Address: Kneza Lazara, Kostolac, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYKT

IATA Code: KOS

Category: Domestic

Terminals: NA

Services & Amenities Available: NA

8. Paracin Airport (NONE), Paracin

Paracin Airport, or Davidovac Airport, is located near Paracin town, Serbia. The runway is 50 metres in width and 900 metres in length. It sits at a height of 532 feet.

Address: Davidovac, Padobranska b.b, Paraćin 35250, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYPN

IATA Code: None

Category: Domestic

Terminals: NA

Services & Amenities Available: NA

9. Vrsac Airport (VRC), Vrsac

Located in Vrsac, this airport is one of the smallest airports in Serbia that serves as the training school under the SMATSA Aviation Academy. It has five hangars accommodating flights to agriculture aviation and the school.

Address: Vršac, Serbia

ICAO Code: LYVR

IATA Code: VRC

Category: Training Facility

Terminals: NA

Services & Amenities Available: NA

Now that you are aware of all the names of airports in Serbia, you also have all their details. All these years, the Government of Serbia has taken consistent efforts to improve and upgrade all its airports. No matter where you plan to visit in this beautiful country, these awesome airports in Serbia will make your journey easier and more convenient.
